org.jogger
Class Jogger

java.lang.Object
  org.jogger.Jogger

public class Jogger
extends Object

A server that handles HTTP requests using the provided middleware list.

Author:
German Escobar

Constructor Detail

Jogger

public Jogger()
Constructor. Initializes a new instance without middlewares.

Jogger

public Jogger(Middleware... middlewares)
Constructor. Initializes a new instance with the supplied middleware list. The order is important because they will be called in that same order.

Parameters:
middlewares - an array of middlewares that will be executed on each request.

Jogger

public Jogger(MiddlewaresFactory middlewareFactory)
Constructor. Initializes a new instance with the supplied MiddlewaresFactory.

Parameters:
middlewareFactory - the factory from which we are going to retrieve the array of middlewares.
Method Detail

handle

public void handle(Request request,
                   Response response)
            throws Exception
Handles an HTTP request by delgating the call to the middlewares.

Parameters:
request - the Jogger HTTP request.
response - the Jogger HTTP response.
Throws:
Exception

listen

public Jogger listen()
Starts the HTTP server listening in the configured port attribute.

Returns:
itself for method chaining.

listen

public Jogger listen(int port)
Starts the HTTP server listening in the specified port

Parameters:
port - the port in which the HTTP server will listen.
Returns:
itself for method chaining.

join

public Jogger join()
            throws InterruptedException
Joins to the server thread preventing the program to finish.

itself for method chaining.
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted.

itself for method chaining.
